evidence.text: Person A: At 10:30? I called you at 10:30--
Person B: Mom, did you really think you were talking to Daniel? How did you think this was real?
Person B: He’s making a joke.
Person B: Yes, more than before. Her eyes open. And her face falls. She gets up and shuffles to the doorframe, listening in...
Person B: She’s gotten these calls in the past.
Person B: That’s a lack of presence, darling.
Person A: I wouldn’t be able to forgive myself if something happened to her. Did you know Susan’s mother fell into a fire pit? Completely died--

Person A: It’s a nice idea but I’m not sure it’s realistic. You’ve got enough on your plate and we should be free to focus on our job search.
Person A: Of course, you know what I mean--
Person A: She doesn’t need a nurse. You think she’s gonna listen to a stranger? She barely listens to dad.

Person A: She’ll listen to me. It was one bad day. And if it doesn’t work out, all options are on the table. Okay?
Person B: She got confused at Shutters. She forgot she ordered those spicy tuna rolls.
Person B: Well, the food is good not great.
Person B: I thought I lost her at Souplantation once but she was just going back for more little pizzas.
Person B: It had things she can chew.
Person B: Everybody. Doctors. Professionals.
Person A: Why would you keep that from us?
Person B: Because I’m going to do it.
Person A: You need to be taking care of your vehicle, Daniel--

Person A: Can we not talk about Allie--
Person B: I’m sorry! I know. It’s very hard. I don’t like to see you suffer like this. It makes me very sad. I feel like I want to cry.
Person B: ...Do you need us to sit down with you and order a new license?

Person A: She posted!
Person A: I think by accident. Five minutes ago. Look--
Person B: Thank you! GOD!
Person B: What’s it saying?
Person B: Not on its own.
Person A: She likes her independence from that thing.

Person A: She didn’t want me to.
Person A: I don’t know, mom!

Person B: I can’t... do anything. I literally can’t do anything. I’m such a little bitch!
Person B: What? Nothing! I just... I don't know any facts. I'm not qualified for any job. I can’t do math! That’s basically why Allie and I aren’t together--
Person B: It’s just another thing I can’t do! I haven’t gotten my ID replaced because every time I log on to that stupid website I get confused about the terms and classifications--
Person B: Sure! Or maybe I’m just a little bitch who can’t do anything!
Person B: Do you have your phone? Please don’t keep it on silent. Can you do that for me? For my mental health?
